revision.text:
{{Wired embedded system |brand=RPF |model=Raspberry Pi |revision=Model A |upc= |ean= |asin= |price=25 |est_release_date=02/04/2013 |fcc_date= |manuf_country= |manuf= |manuf_model= |manuf_rev= |availability= |type=single-board computer |fcc_id= |ic_id= |pwr_v=5 |pwr_amp=0.5 |pwr_conn=USB Female Micro-B |pwr_barrel_inner= |pwr_barrel_outer= |pwr_barrel_len= |pwr_vac= |pwr_ac_hz= |pwr_pol= |pwr_poe= |cpu1_brand=Broadcom |cpu1_model=BCM2835 |cpu1_cspeed=700 |cpu1_cores=1 |cpu2_brand= |cpu2_model= |cpu2_cspeed= |fla1=0 |fla1_brand= |fla1_model= |fla1_num= |fla2= |fla2_brand= |fla2_model= |fla2_num= |ram1=256 |ram1_brand= |ram1_model= |ram1_num= |ram2= |ram2_brand= |ram2_model= |ram2_num= |expansion_if_types=SD Card,USB 2.0 |expansion_pcmcia_num= |expansion_expresscard_num= |expansion_minipci_num= |expansion_minipcie_num= |expansion_usb_num=1 |jtag= |serial= |eth_none=true |eth_cpu= |eth_chip1_brand= |eth_chip1_model= |eth_chip2_brand= |eth_chip2_model= |eth_chip3_brand= |eth_chip3_model= |sw_cpu= |sw_brand= |sw_model= |lan_speed= |lan_ports= |wan_ports= |flags=HDMI out,audio out (3.5mm) |tp_firmware= |default_ip= |default_user= |default_pass= |oui_eth= }} [http://elinux.org/RaspberryPiBoard '''elinux.org''''s Raspberry Pi subsection] :[http://elinux.org/RaspberryPi_Boards Board revision table w/ pictures] {{WPLink|Raspberry Pi}}
Earlier production run Raspberry Pi Model Bs (pre mid-October?) have only 256MB of RAM. All subsequent Model Bs have 512MB of RAM.
Model A '''Pi'''s omit the '''SMSC''' LAN9512 - they have a single USB 2.0 port and no Ethernet capability.
==Additional external links== *[http://www.raspberrypi.org/archives/6299 '''''A birthday present from Broadcom''''' on the '''Raspberry Pi Foundation''''s news feed] :Full documentation for the '''VideoCore IV''' graphics core (used in the BCM2835) as well as a complete source release of the graphics stack used by the BCM21553 cellphone SoC (which also has a '''VideoCore IV''' core) has been released
